  • Methodendetails

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args) throws org.sat4j.specs.ContradictionException, IOException, org.sat4j.specs.TimeoutException
      The main method of the application. It initiates a dialog to gather input data, constructs a set of rules based on the data, and then iteratively tries to find a set of rules that meet the specified variance criteria. During each iteration, it attempts to add a new rule and checks if the new rule set meets the criteria, including the number of always true/false variables and the target variance. If a rule does not meet the criteria, it is discarded, and a new rule is tried. The process continues until the target variance is achieved.
      Parameter:
      args - not used
      Löst aus:
      org.sat4j.specs.TimeoutException - if the SatSolver max calculation time reached
      org.sat4j.specs.ContradictionException - if there is a contradiction in the created cnf
      IOException - error when reading ir writing files

    • getNextRule

      public static int[] getNextRule(SatSolver satSolver, InputData iD, int[] triedFalseTrueVars, int breakTries, Random rand) throws org.sat4j.specs.TimeoutException
      Generates the next rule to be tested. It tries to balance the number of always true/false variables against the target value in 'iD' first. If the target is not met, it randomly generates a new rule containing one variable which should be always true or false. Example: [-3] or [76] If number of always true/false variables is met, this function will generate the next rule containing negated random chosen variables, which aren't always true/false by now. Example: [-7, -34, -92]
      Parameter:
      satSolver - The SAT solver instance to get always true/false variables.
      iD - The input data object containing parameters for rule generation.
      triedFalseTrueVars - An array tracking the number of attempts for finding true/false variables.
      breakTries - The number of tries for finding always true/false rules. After which the method will decrement the input goal for always true/false variables.
      rand - the random generator
      Gibt zurück:
      An array representing the next rule to be added to the solver.
      Löst aus:
      org.sat4j.specs.TimeoutException - If the SAT solver calculation takes too long.

    • handleIsSatisfiableWithRuleAndAddRuleToSatSolver

      public static boolean handleIsSatisfiableWithRuleAndAddRuleToSatSolver(SatSolver satSolver, List<int[]> nextRules) throws org.sat4j.specs.TimeoutException
      Checks if adding a given rule to the SAT solver creates a contradiction. If no contradiction is found, the rule is added to the solver. The method returns a boolean indicating whether the rule was successfully added without causing a contradiction.
      Parameter:
      satSolver - The SAT solver instance to which the rule will be added.
      nextRules - The rules to be added to the SAT solver.
      Gibt zurück:
      True if the rule is added successfully; false if the rule creates a contradiction.
      Löst aus:
      org.sat4j.specs.TimeoutException - If the SAT solver calculation takes too long.

    • handleAlwaysFalseVars

      public static boolean handleAlwaysFalseVars(SatSolver satSolver, int numberOfVariables, int goalFalseVars) throws org.sat4j.specs.TimeoutException
      Evaluates whether the current set of rules in the SAT solver meets the target for the number of variables that are always false. If the number of always false variables exceeds the goal, the method returns false.
      Parameter:
      satSolver - The SAT solver instance to evaluate.
      numberOfVariables - The total number of variables in consideration.
      goalFalseVars - The target number of variables that should always be false.
      Gibt zurück:
      True if the goal for always false variables is met or under the limit; false otherwise.
      Löst aus:
      org.sat4j.specs.TimeoutException - If the SAT solver calculation takes too long.

    • handleAlwaysTrueVars

      public static boolean handleAlwaysTrueVars(SatSolver satSolver, int numberOfVariables, int goalTrueVars) throws org.sat4j.specs.TimeoutException
      Evaluates whether the current set of rules in the SAT solver meets the target for the number of variables that are always true. If the number of always true variables exceeds the goal, the method returns false.
      Parameter:
      satSolver - The SAT solver instance to evaluate.
      numberOfVariables - The total number of variables in consideration.
      goalTrueVars - The target number of variables that should always be true.
      Gibt zurück:
      True if the goal for always true variables is met or under the limit; false otherwise.
      Löst aus:
      org.sat4j.specs.TimeoutException - If the SAT solver calculation takes too long.

    • getVariance

      public static BigInteger getVariance(List<int[]> allRules, int numberOfVariables, String countSolver)
      Computes the variance for a given set of SAT problem rules. This method applies the rules, represented as integer arrays, to teh c2d solver and calculates the variance based on the number of variables. In case of an error during computation, a default error value is returned (BigInteger(-1)).
      Parameter:
      allRules - The list of rules for the SAT problem, with each rule as an array of integers.
      numberOfVariables - The total number of variables in the SAT problem.
      countSolver - which counting solver should be used
      Gibt zurück:
      The variance as a BigInteger, or a default error value if the calculation fails.
